speaker: Bellows
lines: You step into the bellows room and take the handles.
You pull in a steady rhythm until the fire glows.
Soot blackens the rafters above you.
A pulley squeaks; you add a drop of oil and keep working.
Heat licks your knuckles; you mind your grip.
A bent nail rattles on the floorboards.
Sweat runs down your arms; you keep the air moving.
The forge is ready for a hotter heat.

choices.text: Stoke the fire for a midnight heat.
Step outside to cool at the slag heap.
